item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "[A]ll I want to do is sit on my ass and fart and think of Dante." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Perfectionism is the voice of the oppressor, the enemy of the people. It will keep you cramped and insane your whole life, and it is the main obstacle between you and a shitty first draft. I think perfectionism is based on the obsessive belief that if you run carefully enough, hitting each stepping-stone just right, you won't have to die. The truth is that you will die anyway and that a lot of people who aren't even looking at their feet are going to do a whole lot better than you, and have a lot more fun while they're doing it." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "We approach the divine by enlarging our souls and lighting up our brains." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Michael Robbins
item.description: "The morning slathers its whatever across the thing." -- Michael Robbins

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "Okay, I know--my superpower--I'd be able to shoot lightening bolts out from my fingertips--great big knowledge network lightening bolts--and when a person was zapped by one of those bolts, they'd fall down on their knees and once on their knees, they'd be under water, in this place I saw once off the east coast of the Bahamas, a place where a billion electric blue fish swam up to me and made me a part of their school--and then they'd be up in the air, up in Manhattan, above the World Trade Center, with a flock of pigeons, flying amid the skyscrapers, and then--then what? And then they'd go blind, and then they'd be taken away--they'd feel homesick--more homesick than they'd felt in their entire life--so homesick they were throwing up--and they'd be abandoned, I don't know...in the middle of a harvested corn field in Missouri. And then they'd be able to see again, and from the edges of the field people would appear--everybody they'd known--and they'd be carrying Black Forest cakes and burning tiki lamps and boom boxes playing the same song, and they sky would turn into a sunset, the way it does in Walt Disney brochure, and the person I zapped would never be alone or isolated again." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Larry McMurtry
item.description: "I sometimes think the sexual organs were put there to keep the human race humble," she said. "They've certainly kept me humble." -- Larry McMurtry

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Larry McMurtry
item.description: "If you wait, all that happens is that you get older." -- Larry McMurtry

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Larry McMurtry
Megankellie add a quote by Larry McMurtry
item.description: "I don't know why you would even want to stay with me," I said. T.R. looked stunned for a second and then whipped her elbow into my side as hard as she could--months later it was determined that the jab cracked a rib. Oh, get fucked!" she said, jumping up. "No wonder you don't have no girlfriend if you don't have no more feelings than to say a horrible thing like that. All I want to do is love you. Ain't you even gonna let me?" -- Larry McMurtry

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Steve Almond
item.description: "Every now and then, I'll run into someone who claims not to like chocolate, and while we live in a country where everyone has the right to eat what they want, I want to say for the record that I don't trust these people, that I think something is wrong with them, and that they're probably - and this must be said - total duds in bed." -- Steve Almond

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Elna Baker
item.description: "When you wish for something over and over again and it doesn't come true, something else happens; not only do you give up, but you resent your wish and you resent wishing." -- Elna Baker

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "To love at all is to be vulnerable. Love anything and your heart will be wrung and possibly broken. If you want to make sure of keeping it intact you must give it to no one, not even an animal. Wrap it carefully round with hobbies and little luxuries; avoid all entanglements. Lock it up safe in the casket or coffin of your selfishness. But in that casket, safe, dark, motionless, airless, it will change. It will not be broken; it will become unbreakable, impenetrable, irredeemable. To love is to be vulnerable." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Honoré de Balzac
item.description: "The more one judges, the less one loves." -- Honoré de Balzac

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by H.G. Wells
item.description: "Moral indignation is jealousy with a halo." -- H.G. Wells

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Hope begins in the dark, the stubborn hope that if you just show up and try to do the right thing, the dawn will come. You wait and watch and work: you don't give up." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "It was always himself that the coward abandoned first. After this all other betrayals came easily." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Kenneth Clark
item.description: "At this point I reveal myself in my true colours, as a stick-in-the-mud. I hold a number of beliefs that have been repudiated by the liveliest intellects of our time. I believe that order is better than chaos, creation better than destruction. I prefer gentleness to violence, forgiveness to vendetta. On the whole I think that knowledge is preferable to ignorance, and I am sure that human sympathy is more valuable than ideology. I believe that in spite of the recent triumphs of science, men haven't changed much in the last two thousand years; and in consequence we must still try to learn from history. History is ourselves. I also hold one or two beliefs that are more difficult to put shortly. For example, I believe in courtesy, the ritual by which we avoid hurting other people's feelings by satisfying our own egos. And I think we should remember that we are part of a great whole. All living things are our brothers and sisters. Above all, I believe in the God-given genius of certain individuals, and I value a society that makes their existence possible." -- Kenneth Clark

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Tracy Kidder
item.description: "among a coward's weapons, cynicism is the nastiest of all" -- Tracy Kidder

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Nicholson Baker
item.description: "…you almost believe that you will never come to the end of a roll of tape; and when you do, there is a feeling, nearly, though very briefly, of shock and grief." -- Nicholson Baker

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Henry Adams
item.description: "Chaos often breeds life, when order breeds habit." -- Henry Adams

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "People always think that happiness is a faraway thing," thought Francie, "something complicated and hard to get. Yet, what little things can make it up; a place of shelter when it rains - a cup of strong hot coffee when you're blue; for a man, a cigarette for contentment; a book to read when you're alone - just to be with someone you love. Those things make happiness." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "Who wants to die? Everything struggles to live. Look at that tree growing up there out of that grating. It gets no sun, and water only when it rains. It's growing out of sour earth. And it's strong because its hard struggle to live is making it strong. My children will be strong that way." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "They learned no compassion from their own anguish. thus their suffering was wasted." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Shunryu Suzuki
item.description: "In the beginner’s mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert’s there are few" -- Shunryu Suzuki

item.title: Megankellie add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way." -- Steve Martin
